result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM Defendant Beth Lynn Knauss in court.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Beth Lynn Knauss.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Novack indicates DEF requests adjournment, and indicates DEF looking to retain private counsel.  DEF agrees, but agrees to continues with arraignment.  Attny Novacl  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.    Attny Novack indicates discovery has been requested from the State.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Motion hearing on October 19, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:33 AM Defendant Beth Lynn Knauss appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Beth Lynn Knauss.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Novack makes statement regarding discussion with DEF.    Attny Novack indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Sawyer County Detective Poplin, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.  11:39 AM   Attny Novack  Objection - Calls for speculation.  Court sustained objection.  State continues examination.  11:53 AM  Witness identified the DEF,  Court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.  11:54 AM  Attny Novack cross examination.   12:02 PM  State re-direct.  12:03 PM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over, and indicates Dates are incorrect on the Count 2 and 3.     Attny Novack makes argument, request dismissal.   State to file correct dates for Counts 2 and 3 on the information.   Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:35 AM Defendant Beth Lynn Knauss appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court addresses DEF on attorney, DEF indicates now eligible for PD appointment.   Attny Otten (special appearance) from PD office indicates Attny Gregg Novack, has been appointment.   OFF THE RECORD, Attempting to get Attny Novack to connect.   8:47 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   Attny Novack recently appointment.   DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.   Attorney Gregg Novack appears by video.  DEF verifies DOB and address.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 3.   Requests preliminary hearing to be set.  8:49 AM  OFF THE RECORD:  Scheduling.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
